abstract: Group of Republican senators, during hearing of Senate Finance Committee, accuse Obama administration of failing to heed financial warning signs at nonprofit health insurance cooperatives that ultimately failed in 2015; Andrew M Slavitt, acting administrator at Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, disputes accusation; administration's hope was that co-ops would create greater competition in state insurance markets.
lead_paragraph: Twelve of the 23 health insurance cooperatives set up with $2.5 billion in federal funding have shut down, rather than spur competition as intended.

headline.main: Republicans Say Government Mismanaged Health Care Co-ops
headline.print_headline: ‘Red Flags’ Missed on Health Co-ops, Republicans Say

snippet: Twelve of the 23 health insurance cooperatives set up with $2.5 billion in federal funding have shut down, rather than spur competition as intended.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
